title.narrative: Core support Institute for Development of Freedom of Information (IDFI)
Kärnstöd till Institute for Development of Freedom of Information (IDFI)

description.narrative: IDFI defined as the key objective "combating corruption, improving transparency of public institutions, increasing citizen engagement in decision-making processes, achieving higher standards of rule of law, promoting more inclusive economic policies, facilitating the democratic decentralization and the democratic transition processes, upholding media and human rights, and promoting innovations to solve outstanding problems". IDFI intends to achieve the following by the end of the intervention: a) Freedom of information legislation and practice is improved; b) Georgia’s performance in terms of open government (World Bank, WJR and other relevant surveys) is improved; c) Transparency standards of extractive industries are improved; d) Openness of registers (final beneficiaries) is improved; e) New open government data/datasets published on government and civic open data platforms; f) Civil servants, journalists and citizens acquiring new skills of working with open data; g) Extent and quality of public participation in the process of policy development is increased at the executive and the legislative levels (Parliamentary openness); h) The practice and quality of regulatory impact assessment (RIA) is improved;

participating-org.narrative: IDFI/Institute for Development of Freedom of Information

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

title.narrative: Decision on Contribution Core Support IDFI

description.narrative: Some results on outcome level are as follows: On Promoting Open Governance The performance of proactive disclosure of public information on the websites of central public institutions improved by 1%. With the support of IDFI and the Consultative Group, the Permanent Parliamentary Council on Open Governance adopted the Open Parliament Georgia Action Plan 2021-2022 on July 26, 2021. With the support of IDFI and the Consultative Group, the Open Governance Council of SCA implemented the Open Governance Action Plan of the Supreme Council of the Autonomous Republic of Ajara 2020-2021. It is estimated that 13 commitments out of a total of 15 were implemented. On Strengthening the Anticorruption System Sammanfattande resultatuppdatering Conclusion on Performance Contribution ID: 13382 2 (9) IDFI conducted an in-depth analysis of legislation and practice on whistleblowing mechanism in Georgia and prepared the first large-scale study on the issue. IDFI developed the web-page anticorruptionhub.net. The Anti-Corruption Hub website is an electronic platform that will enable people interested in fighting corruption to unite, share information with each other, and jointly organize activities. IDFI submitted a report to the OECD-ACN on the corruption situation in Georgia and met with the mission to provide additional information. Also, IDFI participated in the 21st plenary session of OECD/ACN discussed several relevant issues including regarding high-level corruption. On Economic and Social Policy IDFI continued monitoring and evaluating the government social and economic policy actions in response to the pandemic supporting socially vulnerable population and increasing efficiency of their financing. Analysis of effects of the COVID-19 on Georgian education system was discussed publicly and received media coverage from tv channels. IDFI started to analyze gender inequality issues and plans to evaluate economic loss caused by the gender gap in the business sector. On Promoting the Rule of Law and Human Rights A comprehensive study on the transparency of the judiciary in Georgia was prepared. 26 key findings on challenges and gaps were identified and 25 recommendations aimed at improving the transparency of the judiciary were prepared. An electronic module of judicial statistics was created and as a result the accessibility of court statistics is improved. On Facilitating the Decentralization Process (local governance) With the technical support of IDFI, four municipalities elaborated and adopted Building Integrity and Transparency Strategies and Action Plans. It enabled them to implement commitments under the National Anti-Corruption Strategy and Action Plan. IDFI conducted survey shows that the overall performance of municipalities in terms of publishing public data online improved by 2% compared to 2019. 24 municipalities improved their performance in transparency and accountability according to LSG Index. On Supporting the Process of Democratic Transition Two comprehensive researches on the archives on the independence period of Georgia (after 1991) and Soviet Totalitarian Toponymy in Georgia were created during the reporting period. A new website - historyproject.ge has been launched and IDFIs resources and articles on history and memory spread around the various websites have been collected into this site. Sammanfattande resultatuppdatering Conclusion on Performance Contribution ID: 13382 3 (9) Public awareness about the importance of archives was increased via articles, videos, online events and publications. Among different activities worth to mention 3 exhibitions, 2 contests, 1 wall graffiti and other events to raise public awareness, IDFI provided a total of 452 consultations regarding Memory, disinformation and Soviet Studies. The consultations were provided through online tools (Facebook, Messenger, email, Zoom etc. a total of 85), via phone calla (350 consultations) and in person (17 consultations). On Media Freedom of Expression IDFI actively participated in about 40 meetings with media advocacy coalition and media representatives. As a result 25 mutual statements and 3 reports regarding the challenges of media and freedom of expression in Georgia have been prepared and released. Multiple legal and professional consultations to media and journalists were provied by IDFI (at least 20). On Supporting the Public Administration Reform Fifteen regional non-governmental organizations were engaged in the public administration reform monitoring process through the electronic platform created by IDFI. The shortcomings identified and recommendations provided by the PAR alternative monitoring reports prepared by IDFI were recognized by the Government Administration, which vowed to improve the next PAR strategy and action plan and to consider them when developing the new PAR strategic documents.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
